meta.dc:subject: legislation
meta.dc:rights: the Government of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region

longTitle.name: longTitle
longTitle.content: To provide for the celebration of Christian marriages or the civil equivalent thereof, and for matters connected therewith.

section.name: s1
section.heading: Short title
section.content: This Ordinance may be cited as the Marriage Ordinance.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Interpretation
section.leadIn: In this Ordinance, unless the context otherwise requires—
section.def: Appeal Board (上訴委員會) means the Civil Celebrant of Marriages Appointment Appeal Board established under section 5J; (Added 23 of 2005 s. 3)
certificate of marriage (結婚證書) means a certificate of marriage in Form 4, Form 6 or Form 7, as may be applicable, in Schedule 1; (Added 23 of 2005 s. 30)
certificate of the Registrar (登記官證明書) means a Certificate of Registrar of Marriages issued under section 9(1); (Added 23 of 2005 s. 30)
civil celebrant (婚姻監禮人) means a civil celebrant of marriages appointed under section 5A whose appointment is for the time being valid; (Added 23 of 2005 s. 3)
code of practice (實務守則) means a code of practice issued under section 5C(1); (Added 23 of 2005 s. 3)
digital image (數碼影像), in relation to a document, means an image of the document kept on a computer system or on an electronic medium; (Added 8 of 2006 s. 41)
licensed place of worship (特許禮拜場所) means a place licensed under section 4; (Added 23 of 2005 s. 30)
notice of intended marriage (擬結婚通知書) means a notice given under section 6(1); (Added 23 of 2005 s. 30)
prescribed fee (訂明費用) means, in relation to any matter provided for in this Ordinance, the fee specified in Schedule 2 in respect of the matter; (Added 23 of 2005 s. 3)
proposed date of marriage (預定結婚日期) means the date on which an intended marriage is proposed to be contracted; (Added 23 of 2005 s. 3)
Registrar (登記官) means the Registrar of Marriages appointed under section 3 and includes any deputy registrar of marriages so appointed; (Amended 23 of 2005 s. 30)
Secretary (局長) means the Secretary for Security; (Added 23 of 2005 s. 3)
special licence (特別許可證) means a special licence granted under section 11(1). (Added 23 of 2005 s. 30)

section.name: s2A
section.heading: Certain notices are not subsidiary legislation
section.content: A notice under section 5, 5A(4)(c), 5C(3), 5D(8)(a), 5E(9) or 5J(5) is not subsidiary legislation.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Registrar of Marriages and deputy registrars

subsection.content: It shall be lawful for the Chief Executive from time to time to appoint such person as he may please to be Registrar of Marriages, and to appoint deputy registrars of marriages. (Amended 71 of 1999 s. 3)

It shall not be necessary in any such appointment to name any particular individual and the appointment may be of the holder of an office in the name of the office, in which case the person for the time being performing the duties of such office shall be deemed to have been appointed to be Registrar or a deputy registrar, as the case may be, and all the powers and duties expressed by this or any other Ordinance to be conferred or imposed on the Registrar or on a deputy registrar, as the case may be, shall from time to time be deemed to have been conferred or imposed on the person for the time being performing the duties of such office.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Licensing of places of worship
section.leadIn: The Chief Executive may— (Amended 23 of 2005 s. 32)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by granting a licence in respect of any place of public worship, license such place to be a place for celebration of marriages; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: cancel any such licence at any time.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Notification of licence
section.content: Whenever the Chief Executive grants or cancels any licence under section 4, the Registrar shall give public notice thereof in the Gazette.

section.name: s5A
section.heading: Appointment of civil celebrant and renewal of appointment

subsection.content: The Registrar may, upon application, appoint any person who meets all criteria prescribed for the time being in Schedule 4 as a civil celebrant of marriages.
The Registrar may, upon application of a civil celebrant, renew his appointment as a civil celebrant if he meets all criteria prescribed for the time being in Schedule 4.

subsection.leadIn: An appointment—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: made under subsection (1); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: renewed under subsection (2),

subsection.continued: is valid for 5 years. This period of 5 years shall not be affected by any suspension under section 5E.

subsection.leadIn: The Registrar shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: effect an appointment by giving the applicant concerned a written notice;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: effect a renewal of appointment by giving the civil celebrant concerned a written notice; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: publish an appointment or a renewal of appointment by notice in the Gazette.

section.name: s5B
section.heading: Application for appointment as civil celebrant or renewal of appointment

subsection.leadIn: An application for appointment or renewal of appointment under section 5A shall be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in such form as the Registrar may specify;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: submitted in such manner as the Registrar may specify;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: accompanied by such information or documents as the Registrar may specify or as he may reasonably require;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: accompanied by the prescribed fee for application processing; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: accompanied by the prescribed fee for—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: appointment as civil celebrant; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: renewal of appointment as civil celebrant,

subsection.content: The Registrar may refuse to process an application if subsection (1) is not complied with in relation to it.

subsection.leadIn: The Registrar shall refuse an application if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the applicant does not meet any criterion prescribed in Schedule 4; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a notice given under section 5D(9) is in force in relation to the applicant.

subsection.leadIn: If an application is refused by the Registrar—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: he shall give the applicant a written notice of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the refusal; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the reason for the refusal; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the prescribed fee for—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: appointment as civil celebrant; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: renewal of appointment as civil celebrant,

paragraph.continued: as may be appropriate, shall be refunded to the applicant.

subsection.leadIn: Where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person applies for appointment or renewal of appointment by virtue of a professional qualification prescribed in Schedule 4; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: he is a member of a professional body which has statutory authority to regulate the relevant profession,

subsection.continued: the Registrar may consult the body on whether the applicant meets any criterion prescribed in Schedule 4.

section.name: s5C
section.heading: Code of practice for civil celebrants

subsection.content: The Registrar may issue such code of practice as he considers appropriate for the purpose of providing practical guidance in respect of the professional conduct of civil celebrants.
The Registrar may from time to time revise a code of practice.

subsection.leadIn: The Registrar shall publish by notice in the Gazette—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a code of practice and its commencement date; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the particulars of any revision under subsection (2) and its commencement date.

section.name: s5D
section.heading: Cancellation of appointment of civil celebrant

subsection.leadIn: The Registrar may cancel the appointment of a civil celebrant—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: if the civil celebrant ceases to meet any criterion prescribed in Schedule 4 as in force—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: at the time of the appointment; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: at the time of the latest renewal of the appointment,

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if he is satisfied that at the time of the appointment or renewal of appointment, as may be appropriate, the civil celebrant did not meet any criterion so prescribed;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if the civil celebrant contravenes a code of practice;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: if the civil celebrant is convicted of an offence under this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: upon a written request of the civil celebrant; or

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: if the civil celebrant dies.

subsection.content: The Registrar may cancel the appointment of a civil celebrant under subsection (1) notwithstanding that the appointment has already been suspended under section 5E.

subsection.leadIn: Where a civil celebrant is a member of a professional body, the Registrar may consult the body on whether—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the civil celebrant ceases to meet any criterion prescribed in Schedule 4 as in force—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: at the time of his appointment; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: at the time of the latest renewal of his appointment,

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the civil celebrant met any criterion so prescribed when—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: he was appointed a civil celebrant; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: his appointment was renewed,

subsection.content: Except where subsection (7) applies, if the Registrar intends to cancel the appointment of a person under subsection (1)(a), (b), (c) or (d), the Registrar shall give the person a written notice of the intention and the reason for the proposed cancellation.

If the Registrar gives a notice to a person under subsection (4), the person may, within 14 days after the date of the notice or such longer period as the Registrar may allow, make representation to the Registrar in the manner specified in the notice.

subsection.leadIn: The Registrar shall not cancel the appointment of a person until—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the 14-day period or longer period (if any) referred to in subsection (5) has expired and the person has not made any representation; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person has made representation and the Registrar has considered the representation.

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a civil celebrant—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: was appointed by virtue of meeting the criterion prescribed in paragraph 1(a) of Schedule 4; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: has his name struck off from the roll of the solicitors of the High Court; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a civil celebrant—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: was appointed by virtue of meeting the criterion prescribed in paragraph 1(b) of Schedule 4; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: has his name struck off from the register of notaries public,

subsection.continued: his appointment as a civil celebrant is deemed to be cancelled under subsection (1).

subsection.leadIn: If the Registrar cancels the appointment of a person, he shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: publish the cancellation by notice in the Gazette; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: give the person a written notice of the cancellation.

subsection.content: If the Registrar cancels the appointment of a person under subsection (1)(c) or (d), he may, by giving the person a written notice, prohibit the person from applying for appointment under section 5B in such period as he may specify in the notice.
A period specified under subsection (9) shall not be longer than 3 years.
If an appointment is cancelled, no fee paid in accordance with section 5B(1)(e) in respect of the appointment or the renewal of it shall be refunded.

section.name: s5E
section.heading: Suspension of appointment

subsection.content: If a civil celebrant contravenes a code of practice, the Registrar may, by giving the person a written notice, suspend the appointment of the civil celebrant for such period as the Registrar may specify in the notice.
Subsection (1) is without prejudice to section 5D(1)(c).

subsection.leadIn: If the Registrar intends to suspend the appointment of a person under subsection (1), the Registrar shall give the person a written notice of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the intention;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the reason for the proposed suspension; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the length of the proposed suspension period.

subsection.content: If the Registrar gives a notice to a person under subsection (3), the person may, within 14 days after the date of the notice or such longer period as the Registrar may allow, make representation to the Registrar in the manner specified in the notice.

subsection.leadIn: The Registrar shall not suspend the appointment of a person until—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the 14-day period or longer period (if any) referred to in subsection (4) has expired and the person has not made any representation; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person has made representation and the Registrar has considered the representation.

subsection.leadIn: A period specified under subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may be longer or shorter than the proposed suspension period referred to in subsection (3)(c); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: shall not be longer than 18 months.

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a person—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: is appointed as a civil celebrant by virtue of meeting the criterion prescribed in paragraph 1(a) of Schedule 4; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: is subsequently suspended from practice as a solicitor for any period by a Solicitors Disciplinary Tribunal under section 10 of the Legal Practitioners Ordinance (Cap. 159); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a person—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: is appointed as a civil celebrant by virtue of meeting the criterion prescribed in paragraph 1(b) of Schedule 4; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: is subsequently suspended from practice as a notary public for any period by a Notaries Public Disciplinary Tribunal under section 40J of the Legal Practitioners Ordinance (Cap. 159),

subsection.continued: his appointment as a civil celebrant shall be suspended during that period.

subsection.content: An appointment suspended under this section shall not, during the suspension period, be regarded as valid for the purposes of the definition of civil celebrant in section 2.
If the appointment of a civil celebrant is suspended, the Registrar shall publish the suspension by notice in the Gazette.
If an appointment is suspended, no fee paid in accordance with section 5B(1)(e) in respect of the appointment or the renewal of it shall be refunded.

section.name: s5F
section.heading: Marriage not affected by defect in civil celebrant’s appointment
section.leadIn: Without prejudice to the generality of section 27(3), the validity of a marriage celebrated by a civil celebrant shall not be affected by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any irregularity in the appointment of the civil celebrant by the Registrar;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the fact that the civil celebrant was not—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: eligible for appointment at the time of his appointment; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: eligible for having his appointment renewed at the time of renewal of his appointment,

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the fact that the appointment of the civil celebrant was, at the time of the celebration, liable to be cancelled or suspended.

section.name: s5G
section.heading: Return documents to Registrar in case of cancellation or suspension

subsection.leadIn: A civil celebrant whose appointment is cancelled under section 5D(1) or suspended under section 5E shall deliver—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the notice of appointment or renewal of appointment given to him by the Registrar;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: all notices of intended marriage supplied to him under section 8 (including those which have been cancelled); and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: all marriage certificates supplied to him under section 20A that have not been issued (including those which have been cancelled),

subsection.continued: to the Registrar within 14 days after such cancellation or suspension.

subsection.leadIn: Where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the appointment of a civil celebrant is suspended for a period; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the civil celebrant delivers any notice of appointment or renewal of appointment to the Registrar in accordance with subsection (1)(a),

subsection.continued: the Registrar shall return such notice to the civil celebrant as soon as practicable after the expiry of that period.

section.name: s5H
section.heading: Civil celebrant shall provide information

subsection.content: For the purpose of investigating and obtaining evidence of any suspected offence under this Ordinance or of any suspected contravention of a code of practice, the Registrar may request a civil celebrant to provide information in relation to the practice of the civil celebrant. The civil celebrant shall provide such information as soon as practicable upon receiving the request of the Registrar.

subsection.leadIn: If a civil celebrant ceases to meet any criterion prescribed in Schedule 4 as in force—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: at the time of his appointment; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: at the time of the latest renewal of his appointment,

subsection.continued: as may be appropriate, he shall, within 14 days of such cessation, notify the Registrar in writing of such cessation.

section.name: s5I
section.heading: Manner of giving notice
section.content: A written notice that may be given or is required to be given under this Part to a person shall be sent by post to the person’s last address known to the Registrar.

part.name: P4
part.heading: Appeals relating to Appointment of Civil Celebrants

section.name: s5J
section.heading: Civil Celebrant of Marriages Appointment Appeal Board

subsection.content: There shall be a Civil Celebrant of Marriages Appointment Appeal Board.

subsection.leadIn: The Appeal Board comprises—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a Chairperson;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: such number of Deputy Chairpersons as the Secretary considers necessary; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: such number of members as the Secretary considers necessary.

subsection.content: The Chairperson, Deputy Chairpersons and members of the Appeal Board shall be appointed by the Secretary for a term specified in the instrument of appointment.
A public officer shall not be appointed under subsection (3).
The Secretary shall give notice of all appointments made under subsection (3) in the Gazette.
The function of the Appeal Board is to hear and determine appeals lodged under section 5K.
The Chairperson, Deputy Chairpersons and members of the Appeal Board shall be paid such remuneration as the Secretary may determine.

section.name: s5K
section.heading: Registrar’s decisions subject to appeal

subsection.content: An applicant who is aggrieved by the refusal of his application under section 5B(3) may appeal to the Appeal Board against the decision of the Registrar.
A civil celebrant who is aggrieved by the cancellation of his appointment under section 5D(1) (except by virtue of section 5D(7)) may appeal to the Appeal Board against the decision of the Registrar.
A person who is aggrieved by a notice given to him under section 5D(9) may appeal to the Appeal Board against the decision of the Registrar.
A civil celebrant who is aggrieved by a suspension of his appointment under section 5E(1) may appeal to the Appeal Board against the decision of the Registrar.
An appeal under subsection (2), (3) or (4) does not suspend the decision of the Registrar appealed against.

section.name: s5L
section.heading: Decisions of Appeal Board

subsection.leadIn: The Appeal Board may, on an appeal lodged under section 5K against a decision of the Registrar—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: confirm the decision appealed against and dismiss the appeal accordingly;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: revoke the decision appealed against and substitute any decision that the Registrar could have made for the decision appealed against; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: revoke the decision appealed against.

subsection.content: An appointment cancelled under subsection (1)(b) shall, for the purposes of other provisions of this Ordinance (except section 5K), be regarded as being cancelled under section 5D(1).

If the Appeal Board gives under subsection (1)(b) a notice that the Registrar could have given under section 5D(9), the notice shall, for the purposes of other provisions of this Ordinance (except section 5K), be regarded as a notice given under section 5D(9).
An appointment suspended under subsection (1)(b) shall, for the purposes of other provisions of this Ordinance (except section 5K), be regarded as being suspended under section 5E(1).

section.name: s5M
section.heading: Decision of Appeal Board is final
section.content: The decision of the Appeal Board on an appeal shall be final.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Giving of notice of intended marriage

subsection.content: Whenever any persons desire to marry, one of the proposed parties to the intended marriage shall give a notice of intended marriage to the Registrar in Form 1 in Schedule 1 either directly or through a civil celebrant. (Amended 14 of 1926 s. 5; 20 of 1948 s. 4; 1 of 1960 s. 3; 23 of 2005 ss. 6 & 35)
Every notice of intended marriage shall be signed by the party giving the notice. (Amended 23 of 2005 s. 35)

subsection.leadIn: A notice of intended marriage given through a civil celebrant shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be accompanied by the prescribed fee for filing and exhibition of the notice; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: subject to section 6A(c), be given within the period of 3 months preceding the proposed date of marriage. (Added 23 of 2005 s. 6)

subsection.content: A notice of intended marriage shall not be invalidated by any change in any information contained in it, but the Registrar may require the parties to make an appropriate amendment to it. (Added 23 of 2005 s. 35)

section.name: s6A
section.heading: Provisions applicable where notice of intended marriage is given through civil celebrant
section.leadIn: Where a civil celebrant agrees to be a civil celebrant through whom a notice of intended marriage is given to the Registrar, the civil celebrant shall, as soon as practicable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: accept the notice if it is duly completed and accompanied by the prescribed fee for filing and exhibition of the notice;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: collect the prescribed fee on behalf of the Registrar; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: transmit—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the notice;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the prescribed fee;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the affidavit taken under section 12 in respect of the intended marriage; and

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: (where applicable) the written consent produced to him under section 14(1A),

section.name: s7
section.heading: Filing, exhibition and inspection of notice of intended marriage

subsection.content: The Registrar shall file every notice of intended marriage given to him in his office. (Amended 14 of 1926 s. 5; 20 of 1948 s. 4)

He shall exhibit one copy of Part I of a notice of intended marriage at the office of the Registrar and may, if he thinks fit, exhibit copies in other conspicuous places open to the public, and shall keep every such copy so exhibited until he issues a certificate as hereinafter mentioned or until the 3 months referred to in section 10 expire. (Amended 50 of 1911; 51 of 1911; 62 of 1911 Schedule; 63 of 1911 Schedule; 14 of 1926 s. 5; 20 of 1948 s. 4)

The Registrar may cause all notices of intended marriage filed in his office under this section and copies of Part I of such notices produced for inspection under subsection (4) to be recorded in the form of digital image. (Replaced 80 of 1997 s. 73. Amended 8 of 2006 s. 42)

The Registrar shall, upon request by any person to inspect any notice of intended marriage filed under this section, produce to such person for inspection a copy of Part I of such notice (including any copy in the form of a hard copy of the digital image of such notice) and such copy shall be the same copy to be produced for inspection by any person who makes a request under this subsection. (Replaced 80 of 1997 s. 73. Amended 8 of 2006 s. 42)

section.name: s8
section.heading: Supply of forms
section.content: The Registrar shall supply forms of notice of intended marriage gratuitously to persons applying for the same.

section.name: s9
section.heading: Issue of certificate of the Registrar

content.leadIn: At any time not more than 3 months or less than 15 days after the giving of a notice of intended marriage, the Registrar shall, on the request of either of the parties, issue a Certificate of Registrar of Marriages in Form 2 in Schedule 1: (Amended 14 of 1926 s. 5; 20 of 1948 s. 4; 1 of 1960 s. 4; 23 of 2005 s. 38)
content.proviso: Provided that, where he is satisfied that there are special circumstances justifying his doing so, the Registrar may issue such certificate at any time within the period of 15 days after the giving of such notice. (Added 1 of 1960 s. 4)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.leadIn: The Registrar may refuse to issue a certificate of the Registrar in relation to an intended marriage if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any prescribed fee that is due is not paid; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the affidavit taken under section 12 in respect of the intended marriage or (where applicable) the written consent produced to him under section 14(1A) is not in order. (Added 23 of 2005 s. 8)

subsection.name: 1B
subsection.content: If the issue of a certificate of the Registrar is forbidden under section 16(1), it shall not be issued. (Added 23 of 2005 s. 8)

subsection.name: 1C
subsection.content: If the intended marriage is to be contracted before a minister, the certificate of the Registrar shall be issued to either of the proposed parties. (Added 23 of 2005 s. 8)

subsection.name: 1D
subsection.content: If the intended marriage is to be contracted before a civil celebrant, the certificate of the Registrar shall be issued to either of the proposed parties through a civil celebrant nominated by either of the proposed parties. (Added 23 of 2005 s. 8)

subsection.name: 1E
subsection.content: A civil celebrant through whom a certificate of the Registrar is issued under subsection (1D) shall forward it as soon as practicable to either of the proposed parties. (Added 23 of 2005 s. 8)

Where the Registrar is satisfied that the parties intend to contract the marriage before him, he may, in lieu of issuing a certificate of the Registrar, endorse on the notice of intended marriage a statement to the effect that the issue of the certificate has not been forbidden by any person authorized by law to do so; and such endorsement shall, in relation to the celebration of the marriage by the Registrar, take effect as if a certificate of the Registrar had been issued. (Added 3 of 1975 s. 2. Amended 23 of 2005 s. 38)

section.name: s10
section.heading: Notice of intended marriage void unless marriage within 3 months
section.content: If the marriage does not take place within 3 months after the giving of the notice of intended marriage, the notice and all proceedings thereupon shall be void, and another notice of intended marriage will be required before the parties can contract a marriage.

section.name: s11
section.heading: Grant of special licence

subsection.leadIn: The Chief Executive may, by granting a special licence in Form 3 in Schedule 1—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: dispense with—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the notice of intended marriage;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the certificate of the Registrar; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: both such notice and such certificate,

paragraph.continued: in relation to any intended marriage; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: authorize the celebration of a marriage between the parties named in the licence at the place and time specified in the licence. (Replaced 23 of 2005 s. 40)

subsection.content: The Chief Executive may grant a special licence without payment of the prescribed fee, or on payment of such reduced fee as, in the special circumstances of the case, he may think sufficient. (Amended 50 of 1911; 62 of 1911 Schedule; 23 of 2005 s. 40)

section.name: s12
section.heading: Affidavit prior to issue of certificate of the Registrar or grant of special licence

subsection.leadIn: After a notice of intended marriage is given but before a certificate of the Registrar is issued or a special licence is granted in respect of an intended marriage, one of the proposed parties to the intended marriage shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: appear personally before the Registrar or a civil celebrant; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: make before the Registrar or the civil celebrant, as the case may be, an affidavit—

subparagraph.content: that the party believes that there is no impediment of kindred or affinity as provided in section 27(1) or any other lawful hindrance to the marriage; and

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: the consent to the marriage required by section 14 has been obtained; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: the marriage does not require any consent under section 14.

subsection.content: The Registrar and any civil celebrant shall have power to take an affidavit referred to in subsection (1)(b).

section.name: s13
section.heading: No licence or certificate if either party under 16
section.content: No certificate of the Registrar may be issued or special licence may be granted if any proposed party to the intended marriage is under the age of 16 years.

section.name: s14
section.heading: Production of written consent

subsection.leadIn: This section applies in relation to an intended marriage if any proposed party to the intended marriage—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is of or over 16 and under 21 years of age as at the date of marriage; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is not a widower or widow. (Replaced 23 of 2005 s. 10)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.leadIn: The written consent of the relevant person specified in Schedule 3 to the intended marriage—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: shall be produced to the Registrar or a civil celebrant before a certificate of the Registrar may be issued; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: shall be produced to the Registrar before a special licence may be granted. (Added 23 of 2005 s. 10)

subsection.content: Nothing in this section shall be read as dispensing with the necessity of obtaining the consent of the Court of First Instance to the marriage of a ward of court. (Added 80 of 1997 s. 28. Amended 25 of 1998 s. 2)

section.name: s16
section.heading: Right to forbid issue of certificate of the Registrar

subsection.leadIn: Any person whose consent to an intended marriage is required under section 14 may, before the issue of a certificate of the Registrar in respect of the intended marriage, forbid the issue of the certificate by— (Amended 23 of 2005 s. 42)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: writing the characters “不准” or the word “Forbidden”;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: signing his name; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: stating the capacity in which he forbids the issue,

subsection.continued: on the copy of the notice of intended marriage produced for inspection under section 7(4). (Amended 14 of 1926 s. 5; 20 of 1948 s. 4; 80 of 1997 s. 74)

subsection.content: If the issue of a certificate of the Registrar is so forbidden, the notice of intended marriage and all proceedings thereupon shall be void.

section.name: s17
section.heading: Registrar may inquire into right to forbid

subsection.content: If either of the proposed parties to an intended marriage alleges that a person forbidding the issue of a certificate of the Registrar in respect of the intended marriage has no right under section 16 to do so, the Registrar shall inquire into the matter, and if he is satisfied that the person has no such right, he may proceed to issue the certificate in due course, without reckoning the time that has elapsed since the issue was forbidden. (Amended 23 of 2005 s. 43)
For the purposes of such inquiry the Registrar may administer an oath to any person. (Amended 80 of 1997 s. 30)

section.name: s18
section.heading: Appeal against decision of Registrar

subsection.content: If the Registrar is satisfied that a person forbidding the issue of a certificate of the Registrar in respect of an intended marriage has a right under section 16 to do so, either of the proposed parties to the intended marriage may appeal by petition to the Court of First Instance, and the Court or judge may hear and determine the matter of the petition in a summary way. (Amended 50 of 1911; 62 of 1911 Schedule; 14 of 1926 s. 5; 20 of 1948 s. 4; 92 of 1975 s. 59; 25 of 1998 s. 2; 23 of 2005 s. 44)

Such determination shall be final; and the Registrar shall proceed in accordance therewith, without reckoning the time that has elapsed since the issue was forbidden. (Amended 14 of 1926 s. 5; 20 of 1948 s. 4)

section.name: s18A
section.heading: District Judge may give consent

subsection.leadIn: If consent is required under section 14 from the relevant person or persons specified in Schedule 3 with respect to a party to an intended marriage, and— (Amended 23 of 2005 s. 45)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of such person or any of such persons being a guardian, there is no guardian or such guardian is dead;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: after diligent enquiry, the party is unable to trace such person or any of such persons;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: such person or any of such persons refuses to give consent;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: such person or any of such persons is of unsound mind; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: such person or any of such persons has forbidden the issue of the certificate of the Registrar,

subsection.continued: a District Judge may, on application being made, consent to the marriage and the consent so given shall have the same effect as if it had been given by such person or any of such persons or as if the forbidding of the issue of the certificate of the Registrar had been withdrawn. (Replaced 80 of 1997 s. 31. Amended 23 of 2005 s. 45)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.content: For the avoidance of doubt, it is hereby declared that where consent is required under section 14 from either parent of the party, subsection (1) shall apply only if the party is unable to obtain such consent from both of his parents. (Added 80 of 1997 s. 31)

subsection.leadIn: The power to make civil procedure rules under section 72 of the District Court Ordinance (Cap. 336) shall extend to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: prescribing the method of application for consent;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: prescribing the service of copies of the application and any ancillary documents, if any;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: prescribing the procedure to be followed at the hearing of the application including provision for the application to be heard in chambers; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: authorizing the District Judge to call for and receive a report from an officer of the Social Welfare Department or other suitably qualified person before giving consent to a marriage under subsection (1).

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any person to whose custody the party is committed by order of the court, other than a parent; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: all of the guardians, if more than one guardian is appointed to act jointly. (Added 80 of 1997 s. 31)

part.name: P6
part.heading: Celebration of Marriage, Certificate of Marriage and Validity of Marriage

section.name: s19
section.heading: Celebration of marriage in licensed place of worship

subsection.content: Marriages may be celebrated in any licensed place of worship by any competent minister of the church, denomination, or body to which such place of worship belongs, and according to the rites or usages of marriage observed in such church, denomination, or body, provided that the marriage is celebrated with open doors, and (except in case of a special licence) between 7 a.m. and 7 p.m., and in the presence of 2 or more witnesses, besides the officiating minister. (Amended 50 of 1911 s. 4; 51 of 1911 s. 4; 1 of 1960 s. 9)

No minister shall celebrate any marriage until the parties deliver to him the certificate of the Registrar or a special licence. (Amended 14 of 1926 s. 5; 20 of 1948 s. 4; 71 of 1999 s. 3; 23 of 2005 s. 47)

section.name: s20
section.heading: Certificates of marriage for marriage celebrated in licensed place of worship

subsection.content: The Registrar shall cause to be prepared and supplied to all licensed places of worship books of marriage certificates in Form 4 in Schedule 1 in duplicate and with butts in such form as may be specified by the Registrar. (Amended 14 of 1926 s. 5; 20 of 1948 s. 4)
The certificate of marriage shall be signed in duplicate by the officiating minister, by the parties, and by 2 or more witnesses to the marriage.

The minister shall deliver one certificate of marriage to the parties immediately after the marriage, and shall within 7 days thereafter transmit the other to the Registrar who shall file the same in his office. (Amended 51 of 1911; 63 of 1911 Schedule; 14 of 1926 s. 5; 20 of 1948 s. 4; 1 of 1960 s. 10)
The officiating minister shall enter in the butt the names of the parties and the date of the marriage.

section.name: s20A
section.heading: Certificates of marriage to be supplied to civil celebrant
section.content: The Registrar shall cause to be prepared and supplied upon request to any civil celebrant books of marriage certificates in Form 7 in Schedule 1 in duplicate and with butts in such form as may be specified by the Registrar.

section.name: s21
section.heading: Marriage before Registrar or civil celebrant

subsection.content: After the issue of a certificate of the Registrar or the grant of a special licence, the parties may, subject to subsection (1A), contract a marriage before the Registrar or a civil celebrant. (Replaced 34 of 1932 s. 2. Amended 20 of 1948 s. 4; 71 of 1999 s. 3; 23 of 2005 s. 12)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.leadIn: Before a marriage is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: celebrated by the Registrar, each of the parties shall sign a written declaration in the presence of the Registrar;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: celebrated by a civil celebrant, each of the parties shall sign a written declaration in the presence of the civil celebrant. (Added 23 of 2005 s. 12)

subsection.name: 1B
subsection.content: If a declaration is signed before the Registrar or a civil celebrant, he shall witness the signature. (Added 23 of 2005 s. 12)

subsection.name: 1C
subsection.content: A declaration referred to in subsection (1A) shall be in Form 5 in Schedule 1. (Added 23 of 2005 s. 12)

A declaration referred to in subsection (1A) shall, if necessary, be interpreted to both or either of the parties in their or his or her own language in the presence of the Registrar or a civil celebrant, as the case may be, and the person interpreting such declaration shall subscribe his name to it as interpreter. (Amended 14 of 1926 s. 5; 20 of 1948 s. 4; 23 of 2005 s. 12)

subsection.leadIn: A marriage celebrated by the Registrar shall take place in his office, with open doors, between 9 a.m. and 7 p.m.: (Amended 23 of 2005 s. 12)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of a marriage by special licence, the Registrar may celebrate the marriage in his office or elsewhere as, and at any time, specified in the licence; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Registrar may, where, having regard to the number of persons desiring to be married at a particular place on a particular date, he thinks fit and he has given not less than 7 days’ notice of his intention to marry such persons at that place on that date by exhibiting a notice to that effect in his office, celebrate the marriages of such persons at that place on that date between 9 a.m. and 9 p.m. (Added 1 of 1960 s. 11)

subsection.name: 3A
subsection.leadIn: A marriage celebrated by a civil celebrant—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may take place at any hour; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: shall take place at any place which is a place in Hong Kong other than the office of the Registrar and a licensed place of worship. (Added 23 of 2005 s. 12)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: A marriage celebrated by the Registrar or a civil celebrant shall take place in the presence of 2 or more witnesses, and in the following manner— (Amended 23 of 2005 s. 12)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the Registrar or the civil celebrant, as the case may be, shall first address the parties to the following effect— (Amended 23 of 2005 s. 12) “Before you are joined in matrimony, it is my duty to remind you of the solemn and binding character of a marriage contracted under the Marriage Ordinance, which is in law the voluntary union for life of one man and one woman to the exclusion of all others. Know ye, therefore, [name of the male party], and [name of the female party], that, by the public taking of each other as man and wife in my presence and in the presence of the persons now here, and by the subsequent attestation thereof by signing your names to that effect, you become legally married to each other, although no other rite of a civil or religious nature shall take place.”; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.leadIn: the male party shall then say to the female party either—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: in Chinese—
“我請在場各人見證：我[男方姓名]願以妳[女方姓名]為我合法妻子。”; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: in English— “I call upon all persons here present to witness that I, [name of the male party], do take thee, [name of the female party], to be my lawful wedded wife.”; and (Replaced 23 of 2005 s. 12)

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.leadIn: the female party shall then say to the male party either—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: in Chinese—
“我請在場各人見證：我[女方姓名]願以你[男方姓名]為我合法丈夫。”; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: in English— “I call upon all persons here present to witness that I, [name of the female party], do take thee, [name of the male party], to be my lawful wedded husband.”. (Added 23 of 2005 s. 12)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: Where the Registrar or the civil celebrant, as the case may be— (Amended 23 of 2005 s. 12)

subparagraph.name: i
ii
subparagraph.content: is satisfied that the parties and witnesses all understand the English language, the marriage may be celebrated in the English language. (Replaced 1 of 1960 s. 11. Amended 23 of 2005 s. 12)

subsection.name: 4A
subsection.leadIn: Where a male party is unable to make the statement required by subsection (4)(a)(ii) because of any physical disability (whether permanent or temporary) or because he is neither Chinese-speaking nor English-speaking, if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a person other than the male party, the female party, the Registrar or the civil celebrant says to the female party either—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in Chinese—
“現代表[男方姓名]聲明如下：我請在場各人見證：我[男方姓名]願以妳[女方姓名]為我合法妻子。”; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in English— “It is declared on behalf of [name of the male party] as follows: I call upon all persons here present to witness that I, [name of the male party], do take thee, [name of the female party], to be my lawful wedded wife.”; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: upon inquiry by the Registrar or the civil celebrant, the male party signifies, in whatever manner and by whatever means, to the satisfaction of the Registrar or the civil celebrant, as the case may be, that what was said reflects his will to marry the female party,

subsection.continued: the male party shall be regarded as having complied with subsection (4)(a)(ii). (Added 23 of 2005 s. 12)

subsection.name: 4B
subsection.leadIn: Where a female party is unable to make the statement required by subsection (4)(a)(iii) because of any physical disability (whether permanent or temporary) or because she is neither Chinese-speaking nor English-speaking, if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a person other than the female party, the male party, the Registrar or the civil celebrant says to the male party either—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in Chinese—
“現代表[女方姓名]聲明如下：我請在場各人見證：我[女方姓名]願以你[男方姓名]為我合法丈夫。”; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in English— “It is declared on behalf of [name of the female party] as follows: I call upon all persons here present to witness that I, [name of the female party], do take thee, [name of the male party], to be my lawful wedded husband.”; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: upon inquiry by the Registrar or the civil celebrant, the female party signifies, in whatever manner and by whatever means, to the satisfaction of the Registrar or the civil celebrant, as the case may be, that what was said reflects her will to marry the male party,

subsection.continued: the female party shall be regarded as having complied with subsection (4)(a)(iii). (Added 23 of 2005 s. 12)

subsection.leadIn: Upon subsection (4) being complied with—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Registrar or the civil celebrant, as may be appropriate;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the parties; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the witnesses referred to in subsection (4)(a),

subsection.continued: shall sign a certificate of marriage in Form 7 in Schedule 1 in duplicate. (Replaced 23 of 2005 s. 12)

subsection.leadIn: If a marriage is celebrated by the Registrar, he shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: deliver one certificate of marriage signed in accordance with subsection (5) to the parties immediately after it has been signed; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: file the other certificate of marriage in his office. (Replaced 23 of 2005 s. 12)

subsection.leadIn: If a marriage is celebrated by a civil celebrant—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the civil celebrant shall—

subparagraph.name: i
ii
subparagraph.content: enter in the butt the names of the parties and the date of marriage; and

subparagraph.name: iii
A
subparagraph.content: the other certificate of marriage; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: the declaration signed by the parties in accordance with subsection (1A)(b),

subparagraph.continued: to the Registrar within 7 days after the marriage; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Registrar shall file the certificate transmitted to him in accordance with paragraph (a)(iii) in his office. (Added 23 of 2005 s. 12)

subsection.content: For the avoidance of doubt, if a marriage is celebrated by a civil celebrant, the civil celebrant shall not act as a witness to that marriage. (Added 23 of 2005 s. 12)

section.name: s22
section.heading: Marriage by special licence at other place
section.content: Whenever a special licence authorizes the celebration of a marriage at a place other than a licensed place of worship or the office of the Registrar and such marriage is not to be celebrated by the Registrar, the Registrar, on taking the affidavit of one of the parties to the marriage, shall deliver to him or her a blank certificate of marriage in duplicate, and the minister celebrating the marriage, the parties, and 2 or more witnesses shall sign the same, in manner hereinbefore prescribed, and the minister shall deliver one certificate to the parties, immediately after the marriage, and shall transmit the other to the Registrar within 7 days thereafter, and the Registrar shall file the same in his office.

section.name: s23
section.heading: Registration of certificates of marriage

subsection.content: The Registrar shall register all certificates of marriage filed in his office in such order and manner as he thinks best suited for easy reference thereto. (Amended 14 of 1926 s. 5; 20 of 1948 s. 4; 80 of 1997 s. 75)

Without prejudice to the generality of subsection (1), the Registrar may cause the certificates of marriage to be recorded in the form of digital image. (Added 80 of 1997 s. 75. Amended 8 of 2006 s. 43)

section.name: s24
section.heading: Effect of certificate of marriage or certified copy thereof
section.content: Any certificate of marriage filed in the office of the Registrar, or a copy of it (including any copy in the form of a reader-printer hard copy of the microfilm, or a hard copy of the digital image, of a certificate of marriage), provided it purports to be signed and certified as a true copy by the Registrar and to be sealed or stamped with his official seal, shall be admissible as evidence of the marriage to which the same relates in any court or before any person having by law or by consent of parties authority to hear, receive, and examine evidence.

section.name: s25
section.heading: Correction of error in certificate of marriage
section.content: The Registrar may correct any clerical error in any certificate of marriage on production to him of the certificate delivered to the parties, and shall authenticate every such correction by his signature, or by marking the same with his initials, and the date of making the correction.

section.name: s26
section.heading: Searches may be made, and certified copies granted

subsection.content: The Registrar may allow searches to be made amongst all certificates, licences, registers, and indexes in his possession and give a certified copy of any entry therein, and issue a certificate to the effect that there is no record of any marriage of the person named having taken place. (Amended 5 of 1999 s. 3)

A certificate issued or purporting to be issued under this section before the commencement* of the Marriage (Certificate of Absence of Marriage Record) Ordinance 1999 (5 of 1999) shall be deemed to have been issued as if that Ordinance had been in force at the time of its issue. (Added 5 of 1999 s. 3)
subsection.sourceNote: (15 of 1902 s. 4 incorporated. Amended 50 of 1911 s. 4; 8 of 1912 s. 22; 14 of 1926 s. 5; 20 of 1948 s. 4; 1 of 1960 s. 14)

section.name: s27
section.heading: Invalid marriages

subsection.content: A marriage shall be null and void on the ground of kindred or affinity as provided in Schedule 5. (Replaced 23 of 2005 s. 13)

subsection.leadIn: A marriage shall be null and void—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: if—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: by the Registrar in the office of the Registrar;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: by a competent minister in a licensed place of worship; or

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: by a civil celebrant in accordance with section 21(3A),

subparagraph.name: D
subparagraph.content: authorized by a special licence;

subparagraph.name: E
subparagraph.content: celebrated under paragraph (b) of the proviso to section 21(3); or

subparagraph.name: F
subparagraph.content: celebrated under section 39;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: it is celebrated under a false name; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: no certificate of the Registrar has been issued or no special licence has been granted in respect of the marriage,

paragraph.continued: and both parties knowingly and wilfully acquiesce in its celebration in such circumstances; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if at the time of its celebration any party is under 16 years of age. (Replaced 23 of 2005 s. 13)

subsection.content: But no marriage shall, after celebration, be deemed invalid by reason that any provision of this Ordinance, other than the foregoing, has not been complied with.

section.name: s28
section.heading: Validity of marriages
section.content: All marriages celebrated under this Ordinance shall be good and valid in law to all intents and purposes.

section.name: s29
section.heading: Marrying, etc., person under 21 without required consent

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a written consent under section 14 is required in respect of the marriage of a party under 21 years of age; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: no such consent has been obtained,

section.continued: marries or assists or procures any other person to marry the person referred to in paragraph (a) shall be guilty of an offence and shall be liable to a fine at level 5 and imprisonment for 2 years.

section.name: s30
section.heading: Offences by minister or civil celebrant
section.leadIn: Any minister or civil celebrant who— (Amended 23 of 2005 s. 14)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: knowing that—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a consent under section 14 is required in respect of the marriage of a party under 21 years of age; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: no such consent has been produced in accordance with section 14(1A) in respect of the party,

paragraph.continued: wilfully celebrates the marriage of the party; or (Replaced 23 of 2005 s. 52)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: wilfully celebrates a marriage contrary to any other provision of this Ordinance, or knowing that any provision of this Ordinance has not been complied with,

section.continued: shall be guilty of an offence and shall be liable to a fine at level 5 and imprisonment for 2 years.

section.name: s31
section.heading: Offences for failure to transmit certificate, etc.

subsection.content: Any minister who fails to transmit a certificate of marriage to the Registrar in accordance with section 20(3) shall be guilty of an offence and shall be liable to a fine at level 1.

subsection.leadIn: Any civil celebrant who—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: fails to transmit the documents referred to in section 6A(c) in accordance with that section; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: fails to transmit a certificate or declaration in accordance with section 21(7)(a)(iii),

subsection.continued: shall be guilty of an offence and shall be liable to a fine at level 1.

section.name: s31A
section.heading: Offences by civil celebrant

subsection.content: Any civil celebrant who without reasonable excuse contravenes section 5G(1) shall be guilty of an offence and shall be liable to a fine at level 3.
Any civil celebrant who without reasonable excuse contravenes section 5H(1) shall be guilty of an offence and shall be liable to a fine at level 1.
Any civil celebrant who without reasonable excuse contravenes section 5H(2) shall be guilty of an offence and shall be liable to a fine at level 3.
Any civil celebrant who without reasonable excuse contravenes section 9(1E) shall be guilty of an offence and shall be liable to a fine at level 4.

section.name: s32
section.heading: Offence of tampering with records
section.content: Any person who wilfully removes or alters any notice, certificate, licence or other document kept or filed (whether in the form of paper or microfilm or digital image) by the Registrar pursuant to, or for the purposes of, the provisions of this Ordinance shall be guilty of an offence and shall be liable to a fine at level 5 and imprisonment for 2 years.

section.name: s33
section.heading: Penalty on unauthorized person celebrating marriage
section.content: Any person who knowingly and wilfully celebrates or pretends to celebrate a marriage, not being legally competent to do so, shall be guilty of an offence and shall be liable to a fine at level 5 and imprisonment for 2 years.

section.name: s33A
section.heading: Offence for providing false information in relation to appointment of civil celebrants

subsection.leadIn: Any person who provides any false information which—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: he knows to be false; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: he has no reasonable ground to believe to be true,

subsection.continued: to the Registrar for specified purposes shall be guilty of an offence and shall be liable to a fine at level 5 and to imprisonment for 2 years.

def.name: SpecifiedPurposes
def.leadIn: In subsection (1), specified purposes (指明目的) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: procuring the appointment of any person as a civil celebrant or renewal of such appointment;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: avoiding the cancellation or suspension of the appointment of any civil celebrant; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: avoiding the giving of a notice under section 5D(9) in respect of any person.

section.name: s33B
section.heading: Offence of falsely holding out as civil celebrant
section.leadIn: Any person who, not being a civil celebrant—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: advertises or represents himself as a civil celebrant; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: knowingly permits himself to be advertised or represented as a civil celebrant,

section.continued: shall be guilty of an offence and shall be liable to a fine at level 5 and imprisonment for 2 years.

section.name: s34
section.heading: Fines
section.content: All fines for offences against this Ordinance may be recovered in a summary way before a magistrate.

section.name: s34A
section.heading: Time limit for prosecution
section.content: Notwithstanding section 26 of the Magistrates Ordinance (Cap. 227), proceedings for an offence against section 29, 30(a), 30(b), 32, 33, 33A(1), 33B, 39(3)(a) or 39(3)(b) may be brought within 6 months after the act or omission alleged to be constituting the offence is discovered by or comes to the notice of the prosecutor.

section.name: s35
section.heading: Use of forms
section.content: The forms in Schedule 1 may be used in the cases to which they are applicable with such alterations as circumstances may render necessary.

section.name: s36
section.heading: Fees

subsection.content: The fees specified in Schedule 2 shall be paid to the Registrar for the respective matters specified opposite to the fees in that Schedule. (Amended 50 of 1911 s. 4; 62 of 1911 Schedule; 8 of 1912 s. 22; 14 of 1926 s. 5; 15 of 1947 s. 2; 20 of 1948 s. 4; 1 of 1960 s. 17; 71 of 1999 s. 3; 23 of 2005 s. 57)
The Chief Executive in Council may by order published in the Gazette amend Schedule 2. (Added 23 of 2005 s. 57)

section.name: s37
section.heading: Reduction or remission of fees
section.content: The Registrar may, in any case where he is satisfied of the poverty of the parties, reduce the amount of the said fees or remit them altogether.

section.name: s38
section.heading: Marriage under this Ordinance of persons customarily married
section.content: The parties to any non-Christian customary marriage duly celebrated according to the personal law and religion of the parties before 7 October 1971 may, unless the husband has any other wife, contract with each other a marriage under this Ordinance; and such a marriage shall not invalidate the previous customary marriage.

section.name: s39
section.heading: Cases in which marriage of a dying person may be celebrated, and conditions of its celebration

content.leadIn: Where 2 persons who have lived together in unlawful concubinage desire to marry and one of them is dying, the Registrar or any competent minister may celebrate the marriage at any place and at any time notwithstanding that no certificate of the Registrar has been issued and that no special licence has been granted: (Amended 80 of 1997 s. 32; 71 of 1999 s. 3)

proviso.name: proviso
proviso.leadIn: Provided that no such marriage shall be valid unless the following conditions are observed—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: no such marriage shall be celebrated unless both the parties are able to signify their consent thereto and do so in the presence of 2 witnesses;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: no such marriage shall be celebrated where either of the parties is under 21 years of age, not being a widower or widow, unless either the written consent of the relevant person or persons whose consent is required under section 14 is produced to the Registrar or minister, or such person or persons gives or give consent verbally in the presence of the Registrar or minister; (Amended 80 of 1997 s. 32)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: no such marriage shall be valid which would be null and void, on the ground of kindred or affinity as provided in section 27(1);

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a certificate in Form 6 in Schedule 1 shall be signed by the Registrar or minister, and by the witnesses to the marriage, and, where practicable, by the persons so married, and, if either of the parties is unable to sign, the Registrar or minister shall certify accordingly;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: where the marriage is celebrated by a minister, the minister shall, within 7 days from the celebration thereof, forward such certificate to the Registrar, to be filed in his office. (Replaced 1 of 1960 s. 18)

subsection.content: If a marriage under subsection (1) takes place such marriage shall not revoke any will or codicil previously made by either of the parties to such marriage, but such will or codicil shall have the same validity as if such marriage had not taken place. (3 of 1893 s. 3 incorporated. Amended 80 of 1997 s. 32)

subsection.leadIn: Any person who—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: knowingly celebrates any marriage in purported pursuance of this section contrary to or not in accordance with any provision thereof; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: not being legally competent, celebrates any marriage under this section,

subsection.continued: shall be guilty of an offence and shall be liable to a fine at level 5 and imprisonment for 2 years. (3 of 1893 s. 4(1) incorporated. Amended 30 of 1911 s. 2; 50 of 1911; 51 of 1911; 1 of 1912 Schedule; 2 of 1912 Schedule; 27 of 1937 Schedule; 20 of 1948 s. 4; 22 of 1950 s. 3 & Schedule; 1 of 1960 s. 18; 50 of 1991 s. 4; L.N. 25 of 1996)

subsection.content: Any minister who, after celebrating a marriage under this section, fails to transmit the certificate thereof in accordance with the provisions of paragraph (e) of the proviso to subsection (1) shall be guilty of an offence and shall be liable to a fine at level 1. (3 of 1893 s. 4(2) incorporated. Amended 50 of 1911; 21 of 1912 s. 2; 5 of 1924 Schedule; 20 of 1948 s. 4; 22 of 1950 Schedule; 1 of 1960 s. 18; L.N. 25 of 1996)

section.name: s40
section.heading: Marriages under this Ordinance are Christian or equivalent thereto

subsection.content: Every marriage under this Ordinance shall be a Christian marriage or the civil equivalent of a Christian marriage.

The expression Christian marriage or the civil equivalent of a Christian marriage (基督敎婚禮或相等的世俗婚禮) implies a formal ceremony recognized by the law as involving the voluntary union for life of one man and one woman to the exclusion of all others. (Amended E.R. 4 of 2019)

section.name: s42
section.heading: Regulations

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to provide for the composition of the Appeal Board for hearing appeals;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to provide for the operation of the Appeal Board;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: to provide for the practice and procedure for handling of appeals by the Appeal Board;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: to provide for legal representation of parties to an appeal;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: to provide for the appointment and function of the Secretary of the Appeal Board;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: to provide for the delegation of functions of the Appeal Board to the Secretary of the Appeal Board;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: to provide for the powers that the Appeal Board may exercise in relation to appeals;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: to provide for matters ancillary or incidental to the matters specified in paragraph (a), (b), (c), (d), (e), (f) or (g); and

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: generally for the better carrying out of this Ordinance.

section.name: s42A
section.heading: Amendment of Schedules
section.content: The Secretary may, by notice published in the Gazette, amend Schedule 1, Schedule 3 or Schedule 4.

section.name: s43
section.heading: Disposal of documents and microfilms when recorded in form of digital image
section.content: The Registrar may, where any document has been recorded in the form of digital image under this Ordinance, destroy or otherwise dispose of such document, and any microfilm on which such document is recorded, in such manner as he thinks fit.

section.name: s44
section.heading: Registrar may provide information relating to civil celebrant, etc. to professional bodies

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: any information relating to the performance of any function as a civil celebrant by any person who—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: is a civil celebrant; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: has been a civil celebrant; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any information relating to any improper conduct of any person in his application for appointment or renewal of appointment as civil celebrant,

section.continued: to any professional body for its use in connection with any disciplinary proceedings or prospective disciplinary proceedings against the person on such terms as the Registrar may specify.

section.name: s45
section.heading: Saving
section.leadIn: The amendments made to section 27 and paragraph (c) of the proviso to section 39(1) by the Marriage (Introduction of Civil Celebrants of Marriages and General Amendments) Ordinance (23 of 2005) shall not—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: validate a marriage which would have been invalid; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: invalidate a marriage which would have been valid,

section.continued: but for the enactment of that Ordinance.

schedule.leadIn: I, [name of the person making the declaration] of [address] hereby declare that I fully understand that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by taking [name of spouse] as my *wife/*husband in the presence of *the Registrar of Marriages/*a Deputy Registrar of Marriages/*a Civil Celebrant of Marriages in accordance with the Marriage Ordinance (Cap. 181), I shall become legally married and bound to [name of spouse], although there will be no other rite of a civil or religious nature;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the effect of my taking [name of spouse] as my *wife/*husband is to create between us a marriage which cannot be dissolved during our joint lives except by a valid judicial decree; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if I contract, during the lifetime of my *wife/*husband, another marriage while this marriage subsists, I commit the offence of bigamy and will be liable for the penalty for that offence.

schedule.name: sch3
schedule.heading: Consent Required to the Marriage of a Party of or over 16 and under 21 Years of Age
schedule.def: illegitimate person (非婚生人士) means a person who was born illegitimate and has not been legitimated under the Legitimacy Ordinance (Cap. 184) nor recognized as legitimated by or under any law.

heading.inline: Where the Party is a Legitimate Person

center.inline:
Person or persons
whose consent is required

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the marriage of the parents is subsisting

td.p: Subject to paragraphs (b), (c) and (d), either parent.

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the parents are divorced or separated by order of any court or by agreement
the parent to whose custody the party is committed by order of the court or by agreement; or
both parents, if they jointly have custody of the party by order of the court or by agreement; or
in any other cases and subject to paragraph (d), either parent.

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if both parents have been deprived of custody of the party by order of any court

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: if neither of the parents can be traced

td.p: Where both parents of the party are dead
Where a parent of the party is dead

paragraph.content: The other parent and any guardian having custody of the party jointly with such other parent; or
the other parent or the guardian, whoever is the sole guardian of the party; or
the other parent, if the appointment of such guardian ceases.

heading.inline: Where the Party is an Illegitimate Person

center.inline:
Person or persons
whose consent is required

td.p: If the mother of the party is alive

paragraph.content: The mother; or
if she has by order of any court been deprived of the custody of the party, the guardian.

td.p: If the mother of the party is dead

subsection.name: a
subsection.leadIn: a solicitor—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: holding a current practising certificate issued under section 6 of the Legal Practitioners Ordinance (Cap. 159) which is unconditional save as to the condition of compliance with the Continuing Professional Development Rules (Cap. 159 sub. leg. W) and the Legal Practitioners (Risk Management Education) Rules (Cap. 159 sub. leg. Z); and

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.leadIn: holding a certificate issued by The Law Society of Hong Kong—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: certifying that he has practised as a solicitor; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: upon a statutory declaration by him in such form as the Council of The Law Society of Hong Kong may determine certifying that he has been employed while his name is on the roll of solicitors within the meaning of the Legal Practitioners Ordinance (Cap. 159) to provide legal service to the employer,

paragraph.continued: for a period or periods in aggregate of not less than 7 years; or

subsection.name: b
subsection.leadIn: a notary public—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: who holds a current practising certificate issued under section 40E of the Legal Practitioners Ordinance (Cap. 159) which is unconditional; or

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: who is qualified to practise as a notary public under subsection (1) of section 40D of the Legal Practitioners Ordinance (Cap. 159) by virtue of subsection (2) of that section.

section.name: s2

subsection.name: a
subsection.content: the subject of a valid order made under section 10(2) of the Legal Practitioners Ordinance (Cap. 159) by a Solicitors Disciplinary Tribunal constituted under section 9B of that Ordinance;

subsection.name: b
subsection.content: removed from or struck off the register of notaries public before 30 June 2005 under section 42 of the Legal Practitioners Ordinance (Cap. 159) as then in force;

subsection.name: c
subsection.content: suspended from practice as a notary public before 30 June 2005 under section 42 of the Legal Practitioners Ordinance (Cap. 159) as then in force; or

subsection.name: d
subsection.content: the subject of a valid order made under section 40J(2) of the Legal Practitioners Ordinance (Cap. 159) by a Notaries Public Disciplinary Tribunal constituted under section 40I of that Ordinance,

section.continued: during the 3 years immediately preceding the date of the application for appointment as civil celebrant or renewal of appointment as civil celebrant, as may be appropriate.

section.name: s3
section.content: Having completed such training organized for the purposes of this Ordinance as the Registrar may specify.

section.name: s1
section.def: child of the family (家庭子女), in relation to any person, means a child who has lived in the same household as that person and been treated by that person as a child of his family;
sister (姊妹) includes a sister of the half blood.

subsection.name: a
subsection.content: solemnized between a man and any person specified in the first column of Part 2; or

subsection.name: b
subsection.content: solemnized between a woman and any person specified in the second column of Part 2,

subsection.name: a
subsection.content: solemnized between a man and any person specified in the first column of Part 3; or

subsection.name: b
subsection.content: solemnized between a woman and any person specified in the second column of Part 3,

section.name: s4
section.leadIn: A marriage referred to in paragraph 3 shall not be null and void by reason only of affinity if—

subsection.name: a
subsection.content: both the parties to the marriage have attained the age of 21 at the time of the marriage; and

subsection.name: b
subsection.content: the younger party has not at any time before attaining the age of 18 been a child of the family in relation to the other party.

subsection.name: a
subsection.content: solemnized between a man and any person specified in the first column of Part 4; or

subsection.name: b
subsection.content: solemnized between a woman and any person specified in the second column of Part 4,

section.name: s6
section.leadIn: A marriage referred to in paragraph 5 shall not be null and void by reason only of affinity if—

subsection.name: a
subsection.content: both the parties to the marriage have attained the age of 21 at the time of the marriage; and

subsection.name: b
subsection.leadIn: the marriage is solemnized—

paragraph.name: i
ii
iii
paragraph.content: in the case of a marriage between a woman and the father of a former husband of hers, after the death of both the former husband and the mother of the former husband; or

paragraph.name: iv
paragraph.content: in the case of a marriage between a woman and a former husband of her daughter, after the death of both her daughter and the father of her daughter.
